item.title: NeatSpeech) the question about the speaking speed
item.dc:creator: hitoshi
item.description:
Hello, Halle.

I have some questions.
That’s about the speed at “initWithPitch:pitch:speed:transform:” method of “NeatSpeechVoice” class.

The speed value is used to a scale of -1.0 <−> 1.0.
Then, based on 0.0, how many times as fast as that in -1.0 <−> 1.0?
I would like to show in the format like “x2.0” to the user.

When changing the speed value,
Is the amount of change fluctuated with a constant acceleration,
or with a constant velocity?
Please let me know if there is a calculation formula.

And, do the speed value affect the waiting time at the punctuation marks?

Best regards,
Hitoshi

item.title: Reply To: NeatSpeech) the question about the speaking speed
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Hello Hitoshi,

It is dependent on encapsulated details of the voice (it is specific to each voice) and it is also subject to change, so I can’t easily answer this question with a formula. If you’re curious about this for a specific voice, I think the full logging might give you enough information that you could time the playback and find out.
